definition: A young cow or other large mammal such as an elephant or whale.
examples: The farmer looked after the newborn calf.
An elephant calf stays close to its mother.

extra.memory_tip: Calf = baby cow or large mammal.

definition: A sharp, curved nail on an animal's foot; to scratch or tear with claws.
examples: The cat's claw was very sharp. (noun)
Crabs claw at their food. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Claw = animal nail and the act of scratching.

definition: Two people or things that go together; a small number.
examples: A couple of birds sat on the fence.
The married couple danced.

definition: A soft pad used for sitting or leaning on.
examples: She placed a cushion on the chair.
The sofa is covered with bright cushions.

definition: To move quickly up and down; a piece that hangs and can be lifted.
examples: Birds flap their wings to fly. (verb)
Close the envelope flap. (noun)

extra.memory_tip: Flap = up-down movement or loose piece.

definition: To clean and brush an animal or oneself; a man on his wedding day.
examples: Horses are groomed every morning. (verb)
The groom waited at the altar. (noun)

extra.memory_tip: Groom = tidy up or man getting married.

definition: To give part of something to others; a portion that someone receives.
examples: Please share your crayons. (verb)
Each friend took an equal share of cake. (noun)

definition: A place that protects from weather or danger; to protect or give cover.
examples: The cave offered shelter from the storm. (noun)
They sheltered under a tree. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Shelter = safe covering place or act.

definition: A small outdoor area next to a house or building.
examples: Children played in the back yard.
He mowed the grass in the yard.

extra.memory_tip: Yard = open space beside a home.

examples: Zero is less than one. (noun)
There were zero mistakes on her test. (adjective)
